If a small group of living beings (a small population) is separated from the main population, from which it originates (e.g. if they cross a mountain range or a river, or if they settle on a new island, so that they cannot easily return), they will often find themselves in a different environment than before.

This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so that the new population needs different characteristics or adaptations to be a strong competitor, rather than what it needed before.
The original population has not changed at all. It still needs the same adaptations as before.
With time, the new population adapts to its new environment, and then it looks less and less like the other population.
After thousands or even millions of years two populations look so different that they can no longer be assigned to the same species.
We call this process speciation, which simply means the creation of new species. Speciation is an inevitable consequence and a very important part of evolution.

Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from the technological push or the technological imperative to the strict sense that human fate is determined by a logic that is linked to scientific laws and its manifestation in technology.

Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general views. On the one hand, that the development of technology follows a path that is largely outside the influence of cultural or political factors, and on the other hand, that technology itself has "effects" on societies that are more inherent than socially determined.
One can say that the development of roads is inevitably linked to the development of the automobile.
However, a nationwide road network for only a small number of cars is not economically viable. Therefore, new production methods are being developed to reduce the cost of car ownership.
The widespread ownership of automobiles leads to a higher number of accidents on the roads, which in turn leads to the invention of new technologies in the field of medicine to repair damaged bodies.

The forests are not only mangrove swamps – they also include some of the last remaining stands of the mighty jungle that once covered the Ganges plain.
The Sundarbans cover an area of 3,850 km2, of which a third is covered by water and marshes.

With a choice of 17,000 islands, Indonesian food is an overarching term that encompasses a wide variety of regional cuisines that can be found throughout the country.

Spurs are aids for the feet of riders, which hang down on both sides of the saddle.
They give the rider more stability, but there are safety concerns because the rider's feet might get caught in them.
If a rider falls off his horse and gets his foot caught in the stirrup, he can be dragged along if the horse gallops on. To minimize this risk, a number of safety measures can be taken.
Most riders wear riding boots with a heel and a narrow, smooth sole.
In addition, some saddles, especially English saddles, have safety buckles that allow a stirrup leather to fall, should it be pulled backwards by a falling rider.

Downhill sports like skiing and snowboarding are popular sports in which one attaches skis or a snowboard to one's feet and slides down a snow-covered slope.
Skiing is a popular holiday activity with many enthusiasts, sometimes known as "ski bunnies", who plan their entire holiday around skiing at a particular resort.
The idea of skiing is very old – cave paintings with depictions of skiers go back to 5000 BC!

Ski touring with backpack: This activity is also called ski touring or ski touring.
It resembles alpine touring skiing or mountaineering, but does not necessarily include it, since the latter is done in steep terrain and requires much firmer skis and boots.
View the ski route as a comparable hiking route.
With good conditions you are able to cover larger distances than when hiking – only very rarely will you be able to reach the speed of cross-country skiing without a heavy backpack.

Europe is a relatively small continent, but has many independent countries. Normally, you'd have to apply for several visas and go through several passport checks if you wanted to travel through several countries.

Accordingly, you do not need to apply for a Schengen visa for each of the Schengen member states, which saves time, money and bureaucracy.

A storm is the collective term for any dangerous weather phenomenon with the potential to cause damage, severe social disruption or the loss of human life.
Storms can occur anywhere in the world and there are different types of them, depending on the geography, topography and atmospheric conditions.
Strong winds, hail, excessive rainfall and forest fires are forms and effects of weather, just as thunderstorms, tornadoes, water spouts and whirlwinds.
Regional and seasonal weather phenomena include blizzards, snowstorms, ice storms, and dust storms.
Travelers are urged to watch out for any kind of weather that affects their area, as this can affect all travel plans.

Rip currents are the returning current of broken waves at the beach, often at reefs or similar.
Because of the underwater topography, the return flow concentrates in a few deeper areas and a fast current can form there.
The majority of deaths occur when people try to swim against the current, which proves impossible.
If you come out of the current, swimming back is not more difficult than usual.
Try to get somewhere where you won't be caught again. Alternatively, you might wait for rescue, depending on your abilities and whether you've been spotted.

The Japanese work culture is hierarchical and formal compared to what Westerners may be used to.
Suits are part of the standard business attire, and colleagues address each other by their family names or job titles.
Workplace harmony is of paramount importance, with the focus more on group performance than on individual praise.
Employees are often required to seek the approval of their superiors for all decisions they make, and it is expected that they will obey their bosses' instructions without question.
